intro: Gissanthe spiralis, commonly known as the spiral leaf fern, is a unique plant characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant features long, narrow fronds that curl into a spiral pattern, giving it a visually striking appearance. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help anchor it to moist, shaded environments. Gissanthe spiralis is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its elegant foliage and adaptability to indoor conditions.
